topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Deploy the Standard Region using the HCG Dashboard UI (Denver Deployment)

body.p: After the lifecycle manager VM is installed, the next task in installing the HP Helion OpenStack cloud. Follow the steps in this section to use the HCG Dashboard UI to perform the required tasks. Or, you can use the HLM CLI to perform these tasks.

The HCG Dashboard UI is a cloud management tool that allows users to define, deploy, manage, and monitor a HP Helion OpenStack cloud. The tool helps you provide and validate the cloud definitions required to deploy your cloud and guide you through the deployment.

section.title: Launch the HCG Dashboard UI
section.p: The HCG Dashboard UI will be available as soon as the lifecycle manager VM is deployed. The dashboard service runs on port 8000 and can be accessed using http://<CLM_IP>:8000/.

ol.li: Launch a browser and navigate to http://<CLM_IP>:8000/.

Log into the HCG Dashboard UI. By default use
username: cghelion
password: cghelion
If this is the first time you have logged in, you will be prompted to change the password before you can continue. Once password is updated, you will need to log in again with newly created password.

section.title: Specify the cloud definition
section.p:
Use the Create New Cloud Definition wizard on the UI to:
Click the Create New Cloud Definition dashboard.
On the Step 1 table, specify a name for the cloud:
Note: No special characters or spaces allowed;
Specify if you are using HPE StoreVirtual VSA (VSA) and/or HPE StoreServ (3PAR) storage.
You can incorporate back-end drivers to enable management of the OpenStack Block Storage volumes on VSA and/or 3PAR storage arrays. The HPE Block Storage (Cinder) service allows you to configure multiple storage back-ends.
Click Next.
On the Step 2 table, specify the Standard Region servers and map the servers to the controllers.
View the validation results for connectivity and credentials of the Standard Region servers.
Click Next.
On the Step 3 table, specify network information for all required networks (CLM, API, BLS). If you do not have segment IDs, enter -1.
Click Next.
On the Step 4 table, view the validation results for the network information you provided.
Click Next.
On the Step 5 table:
Specify all required variables for the Standard Region.
Specify all required variables for the KVM Region.
Specify information for any VSA and HP 3PAR storage backend configuration.
Note: The values will be specified for VSA and/or 3PAR will be accepted by the application and saved as is to the cinder_conf file.
On the Step 6 table, view the validation results for the DNS Server IP and NTP Server IP.
Click Finish to save all data in JSON files that will be used during the deployment.

body.section:
Deploy the cloud After you enter all necessary information for your cloud, you will be redirected to a page where you can see description and current status of your cloud. The page appears similar to the following:
Click the Deploy Cloud dashboard.
Click Run to start deploying the cloud.
The deployment consists of four phases: Provision, Generate, Netinit and Deploy. As the phases progress, you will see the name of your cloud and current status at the top of the page and the marker on the wizard will move to the process as it completes.
Note: If you receive an error during the Deploy phase, rerun Deploy.
The process runs asynchronously in background. So while a process is running, if you close your session or browser, you can still return to the same page again to check status of your process. section.title: Manage the cloud
section.p: The Manage cloud option allows the user to perform post-deployment activities for the selected cloud. This feature can be launched by clicking the Manage button on the Cloud List screen after the cloud is deployed. For more information, see Administer Your Cloud Using the HCG Dashboard.

You can use the Manage Services page in the HCG Dashboard UI to reset services including:
MySQL
RabbitMQ
NTP
Apache
OpenStack services (Keystone, Glance, Swift, Cinder)
Centralized Logging services (ElasticSearch, Logstash, Kibana, Beaver, Icinga and Attis)
Refer to the Manage Services page list for all of the available services.
You can also edit an existing cloud definition for the Inventory Nodes.

section.title: Installation Troubleshooting
section.p: If you receive the following error during the Deploy phase, rerun the Deploy.
If you still receive this error, try using the command line to re-deploy.
